alert.note: Alert for Brooke; Hancock (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 25 at 12:52AM EDT until August 25 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Harrison County in east central Ohio... Northern Jefferson County in east central Ohio... Columbiana County in east central Ohio... Carroll County in east central Ohio... Beaver County in western Pennsylvania... Northwestern Washington County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southern Lawrence County in western Pennsylvania... Southwestern Butler County in west central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Allegheny County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Brooke County in northern West Virginia... Hancock County in northern West Virginia... * Until 145 AM EDT. * At 1251 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Boardman to 6 miles north of Minerva to Massillon, moving southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, New Castle, Weirton, Steubenville, Franklin Park, Salem, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Columbiana, Monaca, East Palestine, Wellsville, Carrollton, Hampton Township, Robinson Township, and Economy. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 39. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 66 and 100. Parkway North between mile markers 10 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 16 and 57. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
